fields.description:
Please see attached Excel export. There a two minor problems:

1. The height of the first column does not respect the height of the logo image.
2. The top color does not expand to all columns, but only to the first (this has been OK in versions prior to 3.7).

Regards
Lars
fields.summary: Excel export is not formatted correct

fields.description:
"Issue Type" list is empty when viewed in Netscape7.

I just spent a few minutes looking at the source code of that web page and I think I have spotted the problem: this list is the one that has a javascript block WITHIN the <tr> block with the list itself. There are <script> objects sprinkled through the page but none are within the <tr> blocks with any of the other lists.

A proof: if I edit the source and move the <script> (actually two of them) outside the <tr> block, save locally and open in Netscape, the list shows fine.
fields.summary: "Issue Type" list is empty when viewed in Netscape7

fields.description:
James - one of the developers in here just found something a bit strange and slightly scary in Jira.

A few years ago we had a guy called Michael Treanery (user name: michael) working here. When he left in 2005 we moved all his issues to his replacement and closed/deleted his account.

We recently hired a new guy called Michael Osborne (user name: michael).

Today James was browsing through some issues and he found that comments and work log entries dated back in 2005 were being attributed to Michael Osborne. We are assuming this is because of they shared a user name.
fields.summary: New user with same username as deleted user gets falsely attributed with comments and work logs

fields.description:
MailFetcherService does not delete mail message if it is unable to forward the mail because of an exception. We have seen on support.atlassian.com that a mail was being forwarded and the mail was larger than the mail service was willing to accept. This caused an exception to be generated but the mail was left in the box so it was processed over and over. 

A further problem with this is that if the mail is being fetched is fetched via pop then you can still run into JRA-11046.
fields.summary: MailFetcherService does not delete mail message if it is unable to forward the mail because of an exception

fields.description: The [help page|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.6.5/emailcontent.html ] on customizing e-mail content should link to [this page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/3sgB], as mentioned in the [forum|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257240154]
fields.summary: Link email customization document to confluence page

fields.description: Complete the required field to include attaching a document. Select ""Create"". JIRA displays a failed loading error message each time a document has been attached and a warning/error occurs. Why is it not possible to save the latest data entered while performing a validation to create an issue type?
fields.summary: Lost attachment

fields.description:
We have jira installed using mysql database. Besides this, we have conflence installed using its own mysql database for spaces but jira database for user delegation. When using both systems as a user, system logs the user out. For example, 
while i am online at jira, if i log in confluence, automatically the jira logs me out. And then, confluence logs out respectively. 

We are using both systems with evaluation license. 

What may the problem be?

Thanks.
fields.summary: jira logs out when i log in confluence

fields.description:
When closing a support ticket as 'duplicate' one has to then manually create also a 'duplicate' link to the actual duplicate issue.
Should not this be done automatically?
fields.summary: Closing issues as duplicates should automatically add a 'link' to the duplicate

fields.description:
Removing multiple attachments is a common task in support (removing old logs, etc.). It should be a matter of clicking some checkboxes, and then clicking remove, with one confirmation.

Instead you make me click a link for each and every attachment, and then confirm each one individually.

Cf. comment removal.
fields.summary: Improve remove attachments UI

fields.description:
It would be great if JIRA could have a new Administrative permission to that gives the ability to add/remove/delete subscriptions and filters of other users. 
This is especially important when subscription emails are being sent out and you want to quickly remove/change them without having to log in as each individual user to make the change.
fields.summary: Administrative permission to add/remove/delete subscriptions and filters on behalf of other users

fields.description: Security has been set to only allow up load of attachments to authenticated JIRA users.  When a user session is timed out they are still able to upload attachments.  If you provide a URL to upload attachment and your not logged in you are still able to add attachments.
fields.summary: Able to add attachements altough session is time out

fields.description:

fields.description:
Pasting in a screenshot using firefox 2.0.0.1 on an intel mac running os/x fails with no specific errors outputted to the Java Console.  

The screenshot / comment is simply not added. This does however work in Safari.
fields.summary: Screenshot paste in Firefox on mac os x fails
DWIM date inputs

fields.description: Please see it here: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257239951
fields.summary: Issues sending e-mail

fields.description:
French translation is terrible since 3.7.1. Use to be almost correct in 3.6.x.

ex: 
"Creer un problème" means create troubles...  was "soumettre une demande" in 3.6 whise was much better.

... a lot of translations just mean nothing : ex : "Travail du journal terminé",

In order to provide worl load, the text says : "Exemples : 4j, 5h 30m, 60m et 3s.)", but you have to put 4d  (4j doesn't work)!
...

This kind of translation make JIRA appears as a poor software  in front of compagny decision makers... you should better keep things in english if you can't have a professional french translator instead of using "google translate".
fields.summary: French translation is terrible since 3.7.1. Use to be almost correct in 3.6.x.

fields.description: How to search for the issues whose status got changed to some particular status(say,verified ,closed)during a specified period?Please note that we can't use the updated time in conjunction with status as "verified" and "closed" while searching in issue navigator as during that specified period issue might have been updated due to some other reasons(say,because of adding a comment/editing issue etc.).Can anyone help regarding this?
fields.summary: How to search for the issues whose status got changed during a specified period?

fields.description:
{{IssueActionComparator}} class gets dates from two actions calling {{getTimePerformed()}} method. This method returns {{Date}} object, however not all implementations of {{IssueAction}} return an instance of {{java.util.Date}} class, some return {{java.sql.Timestamp}}. If Timestamp is returned it throws a {{ClassCastException}} when compared with Date as per its [javadoc|http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/sql/Timestamp.html#compareTo(java.lang.Object)]

The comparison needs to be modified in order to avoid this scenario.
fields.summary: IssueActionComparator causes a ClassCastException

fields.description: Request for a new Jelly tag that has provides the ability to modify custom user properties (those introduced in 3.7.x) as well as regular user details. This could be used to change phone numbers and locations of users since those tend to shift around in organizations.
fields.summary: Jelly Edit User tag request
Additional Jelly CreateUser tags

fields.description: In Firefox if there are saved passwords for jira, then when you try to change someone else's password in admin firefox will ask you if you want to change your own saved password. If you hit cancel and try again it will go through. This doesn't happen in Safari or Explorer
fields.summary: Firefox password controls can block setting passwords

fields.description:
... or does it?

I cant find it anymore :-)

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest

Regards,
Lars
fields.summary: JIRA 3.7.x documentation doesn't include the Internationlization section...

fields.description:
We had got 10 jira projects associated with a workflowscheme.This workflow scheme was associated with these projects when we had set up jira in our organization in November,2005..After one year, we required a change in our workflow.We  changed the workflow and associated the new workflow scheme with those 10 projects.But this created  havoc in our organization at management level who used to review the progress of the issues created for these projects.They had created the filters based on the updated time of the issue.Now  around 18000 issues have the updated time as the workflow update time!!!!
                We did not expect that JIRA admin changes (like workflow modification) would affect 'Last updated' field of all Issues related to the concerned project.We believe that  JIRA Admin Update must be decoupled from the Issue Update.
fields.summary: Filters get messed up as Issue update time gets changed when workflow gets updated

fields.description: Is it possible to install JIRA and then configure it to the dutch Language??? Using the online demo shows me that the dutch language is not in the row to choose for switching the language
fields.summary: Support for Dutch Language

fields.description:
Here's the problem:

My notification scheme is set up to notify current assignee on "Assign" and "Comment" events.
If I assign an issue to a user with no comment, then notification is delivered. But if I assign the issue and include a comment that is not visible to the assignee, the notification is _not_ delivered! 

I am guessing you're considering it as one event, and since the comment is not visible, choosing not to deliver the notification at all. This is bad for us.
fields.summary: Notification not sent to current assignee if private comment added

fields.description:
When creating a comment, the group dropdown is not shown in alphabetical order. It looks to be using some ID field instead.

This is causing a big problem for us, the details of which you probably don't care about. if you can think of any workaround or database change to fix it, let me know.
fields.summary: Group dropdown not in alphabetical order when commenting on issue

fields.description:
In general, in export, all fields who are in the issue navigator are in the XML file.
But it's not true for XML export and not for "subtask field".
fields.summary: column subtask doesn't appear in XML export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11884].
  {panel}

After implementering Project Roles in JIRA 3.7 you have unfortunately introduced a _major_ security violation.

In earlier versions of JIRA the Administer Projects permission granted a user the right to edit a project, manage components and manage versions. In 3.7 this permission also grants the user the right to _Manage Project Role Membership._

I know this is part of the idea behind introducing Project Roles. But it _must_ be possible to exclude users from this right even though they have the Administer Projects Permission. This could be done by introducing a Global Permission: "Manage Project Role Membership".

In our JIRA installation we have 12 JIRA administrators. The are the _only ones_ that are allowed to manage users and groups. We have a lot of Project Leads that are allowed to Administer Projects. They need to be able to manage components, versions and so on. We even have some _customers_ that are granted the Administer Projects permission because they run their own JIRA projects.

The problem that has been introduced is not so much, that a user with the Administer Projects permission can add a single user to a Project Role. I could live with that. The problem is, that they can also _add a group_. This means that a user by accident can add a wrong user to a project by giving them indirect access (via the group) without knowing it. The users with Administer Projects permissions have no way of knowing which users are in a given group. Only administrators can see this from the Group Browser.

Another is that the users can see the "Assign Groups to Project Role". Now the users can see all the groups in JIRA, not only the groups they are a member of. Users without the Global "Browse Users" permission (which also controls the ability to browse groups) should not be able to do this. In our JIRA installation groups represents customers. This means that some of our customers now can see the names of some of our other customers... not good...

I urge you to fix this in a 3.7.x version a soon as possible. 

Thanks.

Regards,
Lars

Edit: 2017-02-01
h5. Slightly formalised summary
As Jira administrator I want to segregate two Permission: _Administer projects_ (current Permission) and _edit Roles_ (new Permission)
* Project lead/administrator will not have ability to modify the roles (delegate permissions) but can manage their project for remaining admin functions
fields.summary: Security Violation: Manage Project Role Membership needs a Global Permission

fields.description:
Currently you can share a filter with a:
# No one
# Everyone
# A Group

It would be good to be able to share it with a role.

I see the implementation for this being:
# If the filter has projects selected, the user would need to be in a role for *ALL* of these projects. You don't want this person being able to even see issues (possibly via a subscription) of other projects.
# If no projects are selected I guess you would need to constrain the filter to a subset of projects for the Project Role the user is a member of.
fields.summary: Filter sharing does not currently allow you to share with a role.

fields.description:
I am trying to create a permission scheme where a group of users is only allowed to browse an issue if it is assigned to them. By setting "Browse Projects" to "Current Assignee", this accomplishes the goal. The problem is that all projects associated with that permission scheme became visible to jira-users. Jira-users can only see that the project exists and the project leader. This sounds benign, but we have external partners and contractors that should not be able to know what other projects are being pursued. Experimentation revealed that using anything but a group to set "Browse Projects" produces the same undesirable results. 

  Am learning that Jira Enterprise is configurable to the Nth degree. If there is quick work around besides placing all of the group's issues into one project, please comment on that as well.
fields.summary: Setting Browse Projects to anything but a group makes projects visible to jira-users

fields.description:
JIRA user Matt Doar reported as a comment in JRA-11702:

{quote}
I also found another place where the Integrity Checker itself can die:

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot get schemes for null project
at com.atlassian.jira.scheme.AbstractSchemeManager.getSchemes(AbstractSchemeManager.java:105)
at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager.getWorkflowScheme(DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager.java:76)
at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getWorkflowName(OSWorkflowManager.java:86)
at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getWorkflow(OSWorkflowManager.java:299)
at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.check.WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.getStepDesc(WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.java:287)
at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.check.WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.doCheck(WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.java:123)
... 55 more
{quote}

The Integrity Checker should be as robust as possible given dodgy data. Investigate the cause of this and fix the Integrity Checker to handle it gracefully.
fields.summary: Integrity checker dies due to null project value

fields.description:
I have reported this to support (Michelle De Guzman) and was told to report it as a bug.

When JIRA server is setup with a scheduled backup (to XML) and there is some problem with the contents of a field in the database, the backup may fail leaving behing a partial ZIP file, giving the impression that the backup completed without problems.  This happend to me where one of the date fields in the database contained the value 0000-00-00, the backup job would dump the tables up to the point where it read this record and then fail.  However, the backup job created a ZIP file anyway giving the impression that the backup was complete.  

I was able to track down the problem by doing a manual database export using the GUI.  It generated an error message and by looking at the xml file, I was able to track down the problem to the table and record.

I think that the scheduled backup should produce some warning when the job fails and most importantly should NOT create a resulting output file giving the impression that the job completed.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Automated JIRA backup failes without proper warning

fields.description:
As a jira-administrator I can add myself as a project admin (Assign Users to Project Role: Administrators) BUT if I attempt to remove myself it throws an error - "You can not remove a user/group that will result in completely removing yourself from this role.". 

Is this the intended fuctionality ? I can understand preventing non jira-admins from removing themselves but surely jira-admins should have the ability to have full user management control.

Cheers ........... Geoff
fields.summary: Unable to remove user from administrator project role

fields.description:
Since 3.7, some work have been done around I18n.

In the French translation *Issue* which was translated previously by "Demande" is now translated by "Probleme", which has some effects ...

Previously, we was creating some *Issue* (Demande) concerning :
 * a *Bug* (Incident or problème) 
 * a *New Feature* (Nouvelle Fonctionnalité)
 * a *Improvment* (Amélioration)

*Create an Issue* (Soumettre une demande) was in with agreement with the functionnality... 
Now *Create an Issue* (Créer un problème) means that we want to create a bug !

"Create an Issue" may be translated by :
* Soumettre une demande (like before)
* Soumettre un problème (it may be Restrictive)
* Soumettre une requête
* Reporter une requête

Also, *Change Log* was translated "Journal des modification", which was correct.
Now, it is translated "Modifier Journal" which mean "Modify Log"... which is not the offered fucntionnality !

_In all cases, the translation of *Issue* by *Problème* is a severe mistranslation ! And will required to review all languages properties files befire any deployment !_
fields.summary: French I18n : Issue is now a "Problème" !
Hide initialy / Show initialy Comment Entry has no more effect

fields.description:
I am getting this error repeatedly in my logs:
WARN [jira.web.util.CookieUtils] Unable to find a single JSESSIONID to render link to screenshot applet page (for IE bug workaround)

On JSP-9244, Jeff said:
bq.It seems likely that it is purely informational and should be logged at DEBUG level. I'll raise an issue to have it looked at for 3.7.1. 

I couldn't find it, so I'm entering it for you, because you don't have enough bugs to work on. ;)
fields.summary: Debug errors appearing in logs

fields.description:
Well, you did a nice job of preventing workflow updates from updating the update date, but one case was either missed or deliberately handled in a different way.

When migrating issues from one workflow to another, sometimes the status has to be re-mapped. For example, I improved my workflow to get rid of the Re-opened status, so 9 issues had to change from Re-opened to Open. In the change history, there is one entry for the workflow and status change, and the date has been updated.

I can see the logic in doing so, but if you think about it, this really isn't a transition in the strict sense of workflows - it's an administrative change that does not reflect anyone touching the issue. So now, I have some issues that haven't been touched in months showing up on my most recently updated filter. Ugly. I can see this as being a gray area between bug and improvement, but IMHO it should not behave this way.

By the way, changing workflow only took about 3 minutes on 3.6.5 Tomcat 5.5 instead of about 1.5 hours (if it completed at all) on 3.6.3 Weblogic.

P.S. I noticed you renamed the Test project to "A Test project" so it would come up first alphabetically. Try renaming it to " Test Project" where there is a blank in the first character - that does the same thing  ;)
fields.summary: Updating project's workflow scheme caused issue updated date to change

fields.description: Use case: Load a saved filter, changed it (e.g. add a number of projects), save it, Jira displays an 'Old Search Request' next to the 'Updated Search Request'. The changed item (the project list in this case) is highlighted in bleu. It would be nice to also highlight the changes within the changed item (the added projects, as in our set-up this is a long list).
fields.summary: When saving an changed filter, one should not only show what items have changed but also highlight the changes within the item.

fields.description:
The entityengine.xml contains this..

      <user-transaction-jndi jndi-server-name="default" jndi-name="java:comp/UserTransaction"/>
      <transaction-manager-jndi jndi-server-name="default" jndi-name="java:comp/UserTransaction"/>

In fact this only works in Tomcat 5.0. There is a comment instructing how to change the JNDI name to Tomcat 5.5 format which is..

      <user-transaction-jndi jndi-server-name="default" jndi-name="java:comp/env/UserTransaction"/>
      <transaction-manager-jndi jndi-server-name="default" jndi-name="java:comp/env/UserTransaction"/>

I think most people will be using TC 55 or higher now so maybe change this..
fields.summary: Default Jira download should support Tomcat 55 rather than Tomcat 50

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11864].
  {panel}

We need a URL we can use in support and discussions with customers for:

- raising a support request in the correct support project
- raising a bug/improvement request in the correct jac project

If the user is logged in, it should take them to the Create Issue screen with the correct project and issue type selected. If the user isn't logged in, there would be a introductory landing page describing how to create an account and create an issue (since that's what they're trying to do).

For the URLs, I'd suggest something like:

http://jira.atlassian.com/create/CONF

Where the parameter of the URL is the project key. It would be a bonus to include the issue type in the URL (a la quick search):

http://jira.atlassian.com/create/CONF/bug
http://jira.atlassian.com/create/CONF/improvement

Although it's punctuation soup to a user who doesn't understand URLs (and therefore not as pretty), a query parameter might make an easier implementation:

http://jira.atlassian.com/create?CONF+bug
fields.summary: Pretty URL for creating issues in a particular project

fields.description:
The Workload Report  looks kinda shonky at the moment, and can be improved with some minor fixes.

# Add some padding - Headings / inner boxes should have 2px - 5px space between the edges
# Use user full names rather than usernames
# The Issue Type heading seems to have disappeared (there's just a : before the summed up times)
# Widths for Key, Type and Priority should be minimised, so that the summary column can expand more

fields.description:
Something in 3.7 causes the error reported at - http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-140


It occurs in two places, inside IndexWriter.addDocument():
{code}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: docs out of order
at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentMerger.appendPostings([Lorg/apache/lucene/index/SegmentMergeInfo;I)I(Optimized Method)
at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentMerger.mergeTermInfo([Lorg/apache/lucene/index/SegmentMergeInfo;I)V(Optimized Method)
at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentMerger.mergeTermInfos()V(Optimized Method)
at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentMerger.mergeTerms()V(Optimized Method)
at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentMerger.merge()I(Optimized Method)
at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.mergeSegments(II)V(IndexWriter.java:681)
at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.mergeSegments(I)V(IndexWriter.java:658)
at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.maybeMergeSegments()V(IndexWriter.java:646)
at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.addDocument(Lorg/apache/lucene/document/Document;Lorg/apache/lucene/analysis/Analyzer;)V(IndexWriter.java:453)
at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.addDocument(Lorg/apache/lucene/document/Document;)V(IndexWriter.java:436)
{code}

and inside IndexWriter.close():

{code}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: docs out of order
at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentMerger.appendPostings([Lorg/apache/lucene/index/SegmentMergeInfo;I)I(Optimized Method)
at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentMerger.mergeTermInfo([Lorg/apache/lucene/index/SegmentMergeInfo;I)V(Optimized Method)
at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentMerger.mergeTermInfos()V(Optimized Method)
at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentMerger.mergeTerms()V(Optimized Method)
at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentMerger.merge()I(Optimized Method)
at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.mergeSegments(II)V(IndexWriter.java:681)
at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.mergeSegments(I)V(IndexWriter.java:658)
at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.flushRamSegments()V(IndexWriter.java:628)
at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.close()V(IndexWriter.java:375)
{code}

The second one exposes a problem in the close() method which is that the index write.lock is not released when exceptions are thrown in close() causing subsequent attempts to open an IndexWriter to fail.
fields.summary: Doc out of order exception when merging

fields.description:
When using Crowd 0.3.3 and below with JIRA 3.7 you will get a NPE when trying to view the user, this is because Crowd has not fully implemented the PropertySet that is returned for the user (via crowd).

A partial fix for this will be a null check in the ViewUser code for JIRA, a complete fix will be made available in a new release of Crowd (0.3.4).
fields.summary: View User throws a NullPointerException when using Crowd (0.3.3 and below)

fields.description:
A reported case:

bq. After upgrading from JIRA 3.6.2 to 3.7 i get the following errors in my JIRA log.
bq. 2006-12-30 12:19:37,297 http-8080-Processor23 ERROR [jira.web.filters.ActionCleanupDelayFilter] Thread corrupted! ActionContext is not null. URL: 'http://jira.wmdata.dk:8080/int/secure/null'. Attempted to clean up: false
bq. 2006-12-30 12:30:40,870 http-8080-Processor21 ERROR [jira.web.filters.ActionCleanupDelayFilter] Thread corrupted! ActionContext is not null. URL: 'http://jira.wmdata.dk:8080/int/styles/combined-printable.cssnull'. Attempted to clean up: false

Though the filter should be stopping any further damage, this shouldn't be happening in the first place.
fields.summary: Investigate ActionCleanupDelayFilter triggering

fields.description:
JIRA 3.7 comes with a roles "Developers" and "Users" predefined, with the implication that these roles take the place of the default 'jira-developers' and 'jira-users' groups.

In practice, it turns out that migrating jira-users to "Users" is a really bad idea. Whereas 'developers' is normally a per-project concept, jira-users means "people able to access JIRA", and is inherently a system-wide concept that shouldn't be made per-project. For instance, new users are automatically added to 'jira-users', but not to the 'Users' role for each project.

In general, any system-wide classification (jira-users, jira-administrators) should not be converted to roles, and we should not suggest doing so by having a "Users" role predefined.
fields.summary: Remove the predefined "Users" role

fields.description: Attached are the danish property files for 3.7.
fields.summary: Danish Property Files for 3.7

fields.description:
The Preset Filter "Resolved Recently" does not show issues that has been resolved recently, but issues that are Resolved or Closed and _updated_ recently.

Since you now have a custom field "Resolution Date" this Preset Filter could be improved by using this field instead.

Of course this would require, that the field would be implemented in standard JIRA instead of being an extension.
fields.summary: Preset Filter "Resolved Recently" could be improved
Allow defaults for custom fields to be set on a project (field configuration) basis
Allow global permssions to use roles in additon to groups

fields.description:
Trying to migrate 96 permission schemes to roles, the URL looks like:

https://jira.example.com/secure/admin/SchemeGroupToRoleTransformer!default.jspa?selectedSchemeType=PermissionScheme&selectedSchemeIds=10254&....

This failed with a 400 "Bad Request" error. I think this is because the total URL length is 5666 characters, and this is exceeding some limit.

The page should POST the form results to avoid this (and as it's modifying server state, it ought to anyway).
fields.summary: Group to Role mapper breaks - URL too long?

fields.description:
Running the "Group to Project Role Mapping Tool", I get the exception:

{noformat}
root cause

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No user smor found
	com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.actor.UserRoleActor.setParameter(UserRoleActor.java:85)
	com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.DefaultRoleActorFactory.createRoleActor(DefaultRoleActorFactory.java:37)
	com.atlassian.jira.scheme.mapper.SchemeGroupsToRolesTransformerImpl.updateRoleActorsForProjects(SchemeGroupsToRolesTransformerImpl.java:139)
	com.atlassian.jira.scheme.mapper.SchemeGroupsToRolesTransformerImpl.persistUsersToRoleActors(SchemeGroupsToRolesTransformerImpl.java:118)
	com.atlassian.jira.scheme.mapper.SchemeGroupsToRolesTransformerImpl.persistSchemeTransformResult(SchemeGroupsToRolesTransformerImpl.java:57)
	com.atlassian.jira.scheme.mapper.SchemeGroupsToRolesTransformerImpl.persistTransformationResults(SchemeGroupsToRolesTransformerImpl.java:51)
	com.atlassian.jira.bc.scheme.mapper.DefaultSchemeGroupsToRoleTransformerService.persistTransformationResults(DefaultSchemeGroupsToRoleTransformerService.java:57)
	com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.scheme.mapper.SchemeGroupToRoleTransformerAction.doExecute(SchemeGroupToRoleTransformerAction.java:51)
	webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:153)
	com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:54)
	webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:132)
{noformat}

It turns out this is due to a data inconsistency, where a username is referenced in membershipbase, but does not exist in userbase:

jira_activemq_37=> select user_name from membershipbase where user_name not in (select username from userbase);
 user_name 
-----------
 smor
(1 row)

Here is the html source that Jira is creating incorrectly (for INT-2054 -- summary -- Work with implemenation teams on validating "proof of concept" INT-1711): {code} Google issue summary {code}

fields.description:
If you have a CSV configuration file that contains field mappings where the fields do not correspond to the CSV header column name then it is implictly ignored in the field mapping step of the CSV importer.

The import wizard should display a list of the mappings that will be ignored.
fields.summary: CSV import wizard implictly ignores field mappings in the configuration file if they are not from the CSV header
Project Broadcast Banner

fields.description:
The component list has a maximise feature in JIRA 3.7. However, the link to maximise doesn't do anything after the list is maximised.

Once in a maximised state, the "maximise list" link should either be hidden or changed to "minimise list", which reverts it.
fields.summary: Maximise list link remains and is useless after clicking it on Create Issue screen
CSV Import wizard does not check if a summary field has been mapped
Add "Assign to Role Member" workflow post-function
Fix implementation of CustomFieldImpl.compare(Issue, Issue) method

fields.description:
I'm creating a database of bugs in JIRA by using the Import feature.  I have a number of bugs that belong to more than one project, so I created a Project field in my CSV file with values like 'projA projB', 'projB projC', 'projD'.   My expectation was that there would be 4 projects created after this import, but instead I have one project created for each issue, as instead of splitting my string, JIRA took each string as a unique value.  No problem, I just rebuilt my CSV file.  BUT...

Now I have a database with 116 projects, and I have to delete them all one by one!  

Worse, I have the same problem with my Fix Versions and Applies to Versions fields, each of which now has over 1000 different values.  There seems to be no way to delete them 'en masse'.  So this feature would be very welcome. 

Alternatively, if you were to provide documentation on how to delete fields directly in the database, that would also be useful, since it will likely be an administrator doing this task, not a user. 

thanks
S
fields.summary: Provide Batch Operations selection on Projects, other fields

fields.description:
We currently have our Jira (and Confluence) servers behind an in-house SSO solution (we have done the integration ourselves using a filter).

This is great for browser access - but poses a number of problems for remote-api/trackback/rss access because they dont know how to negotiate the SSO.

What we would like to do is bypass SSO for all non-browser access. Problem is that things like trackbacks & SOAP api all use the global Server URL configuration.

Is there any chance we can specify 2 server URL's? One to be used in email (I think that is the only browser related one?) and one to be used for SOAP API, trackbacks, etc.

Prime importance at the moment is the SOAP api. The WSDL endpoint currently specifies the SSO-protected URL - so SOAP api is unusable for us.
Is there a quick workaround for the WSDL endpiont URL problem?
fields.summary: Need to be able to specify more than 1 Server URL (ie different URL's remote API's & email integration)

fields.description:
we have a list of users, who would like to see all the comments related to an issue in the email that they get when a issue gets commented,Operated upon and goes through an workflow action, working on this and looking at the current velocity templates we have access to only one comment object
how does one grab hold of all the comments related to this issue?
fields.summary: how to attach multiple comments of an issue in a mail?

fields.description: Write a Check for Integrity Checker that checks and fixes data inconsistency of links to non-existing issues.
fields.summary: Create integrity checker for links to non-existing issues
Improve CSV importer wizard error messages

fields.description: If I put &&& in this issue description, they appear in the output HTML as three literal ampersands rather than three instances of "ampersand, a, m, p, semicolon".
fields.summary: Ampersands in issue descriptions are not escaped

fields.description:
This can be a problem when switching from HSQL to MYSQL. 

For exmaple, the *customfieldvalue* table looks like this in MYSQL:
{noformat}
 mysql> desc customfieldvalue;
+-------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
| Field       | Type          | Null | Key | Default | Extra |
+-------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
| ID          | decimal(18,0) |      | PRI | 0       |       |
| ISSUE       | decimal(18,0) | YES  | MUL | NULL    |       |
| CUSTOMFIELD | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| PARENTKEY   | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| STRINGVALUE | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| NUMBERVALUE | decimal(18,6) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| TEXTVALUE   | longtext      | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| DATEVALUE   | datetime      | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| VALUETYPE   | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
+-------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
9 rows in set (0.00 sec)

mysql>
{noformat}
where *stringvalue* is defined as *varchar(255)*. The problem then arises when importing custom field values from a HSQL database because HSQL allows for strings greater than 255. 

In HSQL, the field type is defined as:
{code:xml}
<field-type-def type="long-varchar" sql-type="VARCHAR" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
{code}
in {{/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/entitydefs/fieldtype-hsql.xml}}

whereas in {{/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/entitydefs/fieldtype-mysql.xml}} it is:
{code:xml}
<field-type-def type="long-varchar" sql-type="VARCHAR(255)" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
{code}
fields.summary: Field types between databases do not match
tooltip of the project portlets priority bar is wrong for issues with no priority

fields.description:
We should upgrade Standalone to the latest 5.5.x release. I'm not sure why we went with only 5.5.15, but it's annoying when the Tomcat bug you wanted fixed was fixed in 5.5.16:

http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/INFRA-697
fields.summary: Upgrade Standalone to latest Tomcat 5.5.x

fields.description:
I set up a standalone JIRA Demo and imported some issues (about 8000 of them). I wasn't happy with the fields I'd set up and the way I'd munged my source data to fit into JIRA's fields, so I did a Bulk Operations and deleted all the issues in the database. Then I edited my source and re-imported the data.  No issues were created!   This seems like a bug to me. I've checked the support forums and can find no other mention of this behaviour. 

Even though my All filter shows no issues, if I open the jiradb.script database file with a text editor, I can see all of the old issue data in there.  Shouldn't that all be deleted when the issues are deleted?  If not, shouldn't the CSV imported be able to re-import those issues? 

thanks
S
fields.summary: CSV Import won't import previously imported issues even if they've been deleted
Inconsistant behaviour when user is part of JIRA Admin Global permission but not JIRA users

fields.description:
Daniel Hirst writes in JRA-11598:

"Also when there is an error starting up Jira because of incorrect data, the screen displays the message

    Please install JIRA Enterprise, or downgrade your Enterprise data to Standard.

and the downgrade link links to an erroneous page in the docs because it does not yet exist."

==========================================================================

I (Rosie) have now added the Enterprise-to-Standard documentation, so could you please correct the link inside JIRA to point to the following new page:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/enterprise_to_standard.html
fields.summary: error starting up Jira after downgrading from Enterprise to Standard edition

fields.description:
In {{View workflow Transition}} page, the 'edit this transition' link is hidden if the workflow is assigned to a project. 

However if you goto the 'edit transition' page directly (via url) then you can update it with no problem.
fields.summary: Can edit workflow transition when its associated to a project
Edit Transition page throws Exception if name contains invalid characters but still updates the transitions name
Ability to cut and paste a file location into a URL field

fields.description:
When printing multiple copies of multiple page reports with collate check box checked from Digital Supplier the second copy does not print

RDF files open with RPWriter Report Data File Viewer
Tested printing two copies of an 8 page document and collate check box checked - only one copie printed


Tested printing from Word - two copied of 4 page word document with collating checked and two copies printed.
fields.summary: When printing multiple copies of multiple page reports with collate check box checked from Digital Supplier the second copy does not print

fields.description:
A configured 'Remote Portlet' displays a black border/background (firefox 2.0)
see attached screenshot
fields.summary: Improve 'Remote Portlet'  UI

fields.description:
I created a 'remote portlet' (on JIRA instance A) pointing to an 'Assigned to me' portlet in another JIRA instance B.

The portlet appeared fine, but all its links points to the JIRA instance A not B. 

The HTML source suggests that the links in the remote portlet are relative, and so these are interpreted as relative links to instance A and not B.
Because you enter the remote instances URL (seperately to the portlets key when configuring the portlet) that the relative links are pointing to the remote instance as well.
fields.summary: Relative links in the 'Remote Portlet' are invalid

fields.description:
The add/edit page for the 'remote portlet' page has a field labeled
*URL of JIRA instance (eg: http://jira.atlassian.com/:*

The label should be just: {{URL of JIRA Instance}}
and move the example to the description area like the other field on the same page. note: there is also a missing closing bracket.

(see attached screenshot)
fields.summary: Improve 'Remote Portlet' field label and description

fields.description:
Jira allow you to contact adminstrators after clicking on the "Contact Administrators" link (buttom)

I would like to have the possibilty to choose with checkboxes which administrators to contact so that the same mail will be sent to them at once
fields.summary: Replace bullet by checkboxes to allow contacting more than one administators in one mail

fields.description: There has been some changes to the atlassian-extras codebase for the hosted eval licensing. We need to make sure the changes do not make it so that we can not upgrade to the latest version of extras.
fields.summary: Review changes to atlassian-extras caused by hosted eval liceneses addition

fields.description:
When you delete a version that contains no issues, you get the attached confirmation warning: "Confirm that you want to delete this version, and specify what is to be done with the issues currently matching this version" with the options to "Delete" and "Cancel"

If you don't know that there are no matching issues, the form looks like you're being asked to delete the issues along with the version.
fields.summary: Delete Version confirmation message confusing
Expose managers through ComponentManager
Custom message on the resolve issue screen on JAC is overlapping
Beat Current Powerball Record
Random broken pages: Firefox/weblogic bug where 304 response followed by empty content packet is interpreted as 200 and then waits for content which never comes, until the socket is closed.

fields.description:
If you delete a component, Jira offers to map the component to another name.  If you do that, one would expect that component change to be reflected in the individual issues, but it is not.  There is no change recorded in the individual issue.

This is an audit trail issue for SOX compliance.
fields.summary: Component Deletion is not logged in tickets which had their component changed (audit trail issue for SOX)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11807].
  {panel}

As of JIRA 3.4, JIRA has a RegexCommentHandler, which parses emails for separators from broken mail clients (contributed by a user, IIRC). People now want the ability to create *or* comment on an issue, using regular expressions.

We should either:
 -  (preferably) pull the regexp parsing capability out of RegexCommentHandler, and add its 'splitregex' parameter to CreateOrCommentHandler.
 -  create a RegexCreateOrCommentHandler
fields.summary: Add a Create or Comment regexp handler for incoming mail

fields.description:
Hi,

I just installed Jira 3.7. I really like the new feature "project roles" because it simplifies the administration of groups.

Another change (which comes with the "project roles" feature) is that the users who have the permission "administer project" automatically can manage the roles and therewith the users of the project. (I hope I am right. Please correct if not.) As the project administrator is able to add all users who are in the user base, I can't allow them to manage the users of the project. On the other way round I need an project administrator because he/she has to manage components and version on their own.

Is there a way to restrict project administrators to "manage components/versions" or disable "user management" for them?

I really hope that there's a way to do that. Otherwise I can't use the new feature "project roles".
fields.summary: Add a permission to set wether or not project administrators should be allowed to edit role membership

fields.description: Add an administration console option to link up to Crowd that requires zero configuration to JIRA.
fields.summary: Console integration with Crowd

fields.description: There was a problem that both JIRA and Confluence was seeing with Lucene 1.9.1 regarding "too many open file handles". I believe that Chris O has patched the lucene jar and that Confluence is planing of shipping 2.3 with this version of the jar. We need to talk to Chris to find out the scope of the change and if we are happy with the changes role the fix into JIRA.
fields.summary: Spurious "Too many open files" thrown by Lucene. Upgrade the lucene 1.9.1 jar to the atlassian patched version

fields.description: Currently JIRA serves *.wsdl files as application/octet-stream. This is annoying when you want to view it (ASF JIRA has over 500 *.wsdl files). We should map the *.wsdl extension to 'text/xml' in WEB-INF/classes/mime.types
fields.summary: Register WSDL MIME type in JIRA

fields.description:
unsubmitted data from 'new issue' (or other) pages should not be discarded when you browse away and then come back to the screen

To reproduce: create a new bug, start a really long comment, then click on anything else... and hit 'back' in your browser... and you've lost your long comment :(
fields.summary: unsubmitted data from 'new issue' (or other) pages should not be discarded when you browse away and then come back to the screen

fields.description:
The idea is to have a portlet that can be shown in the dashboard displaying an option to upload an attachment, but this is a project attachment, so it is displayed in the dashboard. If the user has rights to administer the project, the upload attachment is present, otherwise only the list of attachments (file name and description) is shown.
One might think this functionality overlaps with confluence, but I don't think so, this is a minor functionality that in my case would be use, for instance to post release binaries and installation docs, so users and IT people from my customers (I'm a system integrator) can download the latest versions.
fields.summary: Attachment portlet for projects

fields.description:
I have just dicovered that there is a way to allow alpha numeric as project key by modifying the jira-application.properties file as follow: jira.projectkey.pattern = ([A-Z][A-Z0-9]+)

Now I would like to modify the key of projects I have already created before to give them this time a more meaning key name.
But I can't ...It seems that once you create a project key you can modify it anymore later on

Regards,
José
fields.summary: Make project key editable

fields.description:
This has been bugging me for a while actually:

* The "Add Permission Scheme" link is at the bottom rather than at the top. Means you have to scroll all the way to the bottom every time you want to add one. Also, its inconsistant with the other admin pages which have the "Add" at the top.

* Adding a new Permission Scheme takes you back to the Permission Scheme list on successful creation. 99 times out of 100, the very next thing you want to do with your newly created permission scheme is edit the permissions. Adding a new Permission Scheme _should_ take you to the "Edit Permission Scheme" page.. .
fields.summary: Permission Schemes : Adding a permission scheme usability improvement
